div.p: NARRATOR: Earlier we saw how there is an interaction between social influences and our choices. The social influences in my life also react to any problem that I might experience.
NARRATOR: Social influences can be positive and supportive, but they can also support my high-risk choices if I am in a socially-dependent group.
NARRATOR: Social dependence makes problems seem like no big deal to me because, after all, similar things have happened to other people I know.
